1115.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the Ban-the-Box Act which prohibits public employers from asking applicants for employment to disclose information concerning the applicant’s criminal record or history, under certain circumstances.

1117.title: Raising the allowable threshold of the coal severance tax revenue fund budgeted for personal services
1117.description: The purpose of this bill is to raise the allowable threshold of the coal severance tax revenue fund budgeted for personal services from one fourth to one half.

1118.title: Redirecting certain funds of the West Virginia Department of Education
1118.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the West Virginia Department of Education to transfer an amount equal to one half of the department’s 2015 budget for administrative costs into a special account for the purpose of increasing teacher salaries.

1119.title: Relating to designation of social workers in the Department of Health and Human Services to promote better student school attendance
1119.description: The purpose of this bill is to have social workers named for each elementary, Â middle school and junior high school in the state who are to be available to teachers, principals, and other school staff upon request, to help improve or maintain school attendance and performance and to improve the health and well being of students at home. Limitations on services are set forth.Â

1120.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1120.title: Relating to schedule three controlled substances
1120.description: The purpose of this bill is to designate human chorionic gonadotropin as a schedule three substance except when used for injection or implantation in cattle and other nonhuman species.

1121.title: Requiring the Public Employees Insurance Agency Finance Board factor in overtime pay received by employees to determine their premiums
1121.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Public Employee Insurance Agency finance board to base employee premiums on an employees’ total wages, including both salary and overtime.

1122.title: Providing for a crime for the theft, damage or release of deer from private game farms
1122.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for a crime for the theft, damage or release of deer from private game farms. The bill makes the crime a misdemeanor; and provides for a criminal penalty and restitution to be paid to the victimized private game farm owner.

1123.title: Relating to motor vehicle back-up lamps
1123.description: Relating to motor vehicle back-up lamps

1124.title: Requiring the election of prosecuting attorneys be on a nonpartisan basis
1124.description: The purpose of this bill is to change provisions for election of prosecuting attorneys, requiring election of prosecuting attorneys to be on a nonpartisan basis and on the same date as primary elections.

1125.title: Relating to the nonpartisan election of prosecuting attorneys generally
1125.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for the nonpartisan election of prosecuting attorneys.

1126.title: Providing accessible parking spaces for Purple Heart recipients
1126.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize, on a voluntary basis, allocation of parking spaces for Purple Heart recipients.

1127.title: Relating to penalties incurred from obstructing, fleeing from and making false statements to law-enforcement
1127.description: The purpose of this bill is to amend the penalties for several of the violations under this section to make it clear that the convicted person may be fined and confined.Â The offenses include obstructing, fleeing from and making false statements to law-enforcement, probation and parole officers and interfering with emergency communications.

1128.title: Increasing sales and use taxes by one percent
1128.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase the consumer sales and use taxes by one cent (from six percent to seven percent), with certain exceptions. The tax increase authorized by this bill sunsets July 1, 2019.

1129.last_action: To House Select Committee on Prevention and Treatment of Substance Abuse
1129.title: Creating a medical exemption to criminal laws against marijuana use and possession
1129.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a medical exemption to criminal laws against marijuana use or possession.

1130.title: Taxing attorneys legal service fees as service taxes
1130.description: The purpose of this bill is to tax attorney’s legal service fees as service taxes, and dedicate the proceeds to the State Road Fund.

1131.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1131.title: The Agriculture and Tourism Incentive Act
1131.description: The purpose of this bill is to enact the agricultural and tourism development act. It covers wineries, farm wineries, micro-breweries, and mini-distilleries. A tax credit is provided for capital expenditures, local regulation is limited and the consequences of a sale of the business are enunciated.

1132.title: West Virginia Second Chance Driver’s License Act
1132.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a program, administered by the director of the Division of Justice and Community Services, to allow a person to obtain a stay of a driver’s license suspension or removal from the commissioner of the Division of Motor Vehicles (“DMV”) for the purpose of obtaining and maintaining employment if he or she makes monthly contributions for unpaid court costs to the Division of Justice and Community Services.

1133.title: Authorizing local units of government to adopt local energy efficiency partnership programs
1133.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize local units of government to adopt local energy efficiency partnership programs and to create districts to promote the use of energy efficiency improvements by owners of certain real property; to provide for the financing of such programs through voluntary property assessments, commercial lending, and other means; to authorize a local unit of government to issue bonds, notes, and other evidences of indebtedness and to pay the cost of energy efficiency improvements from the proceeds thereof; to provide for the repayment of bonds, notes, and other evidences of indebtedness; to authorize certain fees; to prescribe the powers and duties of certain governmental officers and entities; and to provide remedies.

1134.title: Relating to professional and occupational board members
1134.description: The purpose of this bill is to prohibit lay members from having a license from the board upon which they serve; indemnify board members from personal liability; prohibiting impersonation of board licensees; requiring boards to apply to use the sunrise process to expand their scopes of practice; and requiring boards to submit names of qualified individuals to the Governor for possible appointment.

1135.title: Prohibiting the State Board of Education from adopting new Common Core academic content standards
1135.description: Prohibiting the State Board of Education from adopting new Common Core academic content standards

1136.title: Relating to registration programs by the clerk of the county commission
1136.description: The purpose of this bill is to further define the requirements for annual voter registration programs in local high schools.

1138.title: Establishing a specific valuation of managed timberland and timberland that is not managed timberland for ad valorem property tax purposes
1138.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish a specific valuation of managed timberland and timberland that is not managed timberland for ad valorem property tax purposes. The bill provides remedies to persons aggrieved by the valuations and for compliance inspections and notice of revocation.Â The bill provides for appeals and an effective date.

1139.last_action: To House Agriculture and Natural Resources
1139.title: Providing a ten percent discount to West Virginia residents for lodging, camping and other recreational activities at state parks and forests
1139.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide a ten percent discount to West Virginia residents for lodging, camping and other recreation activities at state parks and forests.

1140.title: Establishing two new tax brackets for personal income tax
1140.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish two new tax brackets for personal income tax in West Virginia for persons whose income tax in West Virginia exceeds $500,000 and $1,000,000.

1141.title: Relating to offenses and penalties for practicing osteopathic medicine without a license
1141.description: The purpose of this bill is to align the criminal penalties of practicing osteopathic medicine with those of practicing allopathic medicine.

1142.title: Establishing a recovery fee for the rental of heavy equipment property
1142.description: The purpose of this bill is to create a recovery fee for the rental of heavy equipment property.

1143.title: Permitting nonprofessional personnel to be hired as athletic coaches in certain circumstances
1143.description: The purpose of this bill is to permit nonprofessional personnel to be hired as athletic coaches if there are no qualified professional personnel available. The bill sets forth the conditions for employment and provides for rule-making,

1144.title: Establishing a temporary maximum contribution rate to the Public Employees Insurance Agency
1144.description: The purpose of this bill is to modify the amount of contribution for PEIA contributions to a maximum contribution of twelve percent for employees and eighty-eight percent for the employer for a two year period, at which time it would return to the eighty percent for the employer and twenty percent for employees.

1145.title: Creating the unlicensed practice review board
1145.description: The purpose of this bill is to create an unlicensed practice review board to which licensing boards shall submit all complaints against unlicensed practitioners.

1146.title: Relating to the right of the Department of Health and Human Resources to subrogation for third-party liability settlements, by recipients who receive assistance under the Medicaid Program
1146.description: The purpose of this bill is to .affirm the right of the Department of Health and Human Resources to subrogation for third-party liability settlements, by recipients who receive assistance under the Medicaid Program.Â The bill provides that a settlement in the aggregate that does not exceed $20,000 is exempt from the provisions of this section.

1147.title: Enabling applicants for a certificate of convenience and necessity for a water, sewer, and/or storm water project to file complete applications without incurring the expense of an engineer’s preparation
1147.description: The purpose of this bill is to enable applicants for a certificate of convenience and necessity for a water, sewer, and/or storm water project to file complete applications without incurring the expense of an engineer’s preparation of final engineering design materials or obtaining interests in real property related to the project, and to direct an entity that has received a certificate of convenience and necessity to pursue a rate change through the appropriate process when post-project rates have increased above the rate previously approved by the Public Service Commission by fifteen percent or less, without being at risk that in such proceeding the Public Service Commission will rescind or modify the scope of the previously granted certificate of convenience and necessity.

1148.title: Limiting supervision of laying of lines on state rights-of-way
1148.description: The purpose of this bill is to not allow the state to require a public service district to have a state engineer on site during the entire construction period of projects on state rights-of-way.

1149.title: Clarifying the prohibition of a magistrate assistant being a member of the immediate family of a magistrate
1149.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify the prohibition of a magistrate assistant being a member of the immediate family of a magistrate.

1150.title: Providing funding of state programs through increased taxes on beer, wine and liquor
1150.description: The purpose of this bill is to increase taxes on alcoholic beverages to provide additional general revenue for the state budget. The bill increases the barrel tax on nonintoxicating beer, increases the tax on purchases of liquor and wine.

1151.title: Eliminating the hotel-motel tax on complementary hotel rooms
1151.description: The purpose of this bill is to eliminate the hotel-motel tax on complementary hotel rooms;Â transfer certain revenues derived from racetrack video lottery, and racetrack table games to the state Excess Lottery revenue fund; distribute certain revenues from the state Excess Lottery revenue fund to certain distributees; defund the West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund and West Virginia Thoroughbred Development Fund and transferring moneyÂ that would have gone to those funds to the state Excess Lottery Revenue Fund for appropriation by the Legislature; eliminate prohibition of smoking in certain gaming establishments; provide for Racing Commission to approve number of racing days requested by racing association; eliminate racing day requirement to maintain video lottery license; eliminating prohibition of ATM’s on casino floors; authorize minors accompanied by an adult to cross gaming floor to access food service areas; eliminate recall elections for video lottery and racetrack table games and allow video lottery licensees to serve alcoholic beverages during hours of operation.

1152.title: Reclassifying Early Childhood Classroom Assistant Teacher I, II and III positions as Aide V, Aide VI and Aide VII positions
1152.description: The purpose of this bill is to reclassify Early Childhood Classroom Assistant Teacher I, II and III positions as Aide V, Aide VI and Aide VII positions, respectively. The bill defines terms and provides that pay grades remain the same.

1153.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1153.title: Operating and maintaining a fully interoperable statewide network to facilitate public and private use of health care information in the state
1153.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the board of directors of the West Virginia Health Information Network and the West Virginia Health Care Authority to determine and, with the approval of the Joint Committee on Government and Finance, to implement the most efficient and cost effective method for providing an interoperable health information network, which may include transferring the assets and liabilities of the current health information network to a private nonprofit corporation.

1154.title: Relating to adding an additional type of West Virginia source income of nonresident individual
1154.description: The purpose of this bill is to clarify that traditional lottery prizes from a lottery game conducted by the West Virginia Lottery Commission are West Virginia source income for a nonresident individual for personal income tax purposes, and to clarify that traditional lottery prizes will not be considered as wages for purposes of the reciprocal tax treatment of wages and compensation with other states..

1155.title: Relating to county board regional meetings
1155.description: The purpose of this bill is require regional county board meetings on empowering and equipping boards to attain goals for public education.Â The meeting would take place between August 1 and December 1, 2016 and replace the currently required biennial meetings on shared services.Â Based on the report on these meetings, the Legislative Oversight Commission on Education Accountability will make recommendations it deems necessary to the Legislature for consideration during the 2017 and 2018 regular sessions.

1157.title: Relating to additional duties for the Secretary of State relating to voter registration
1157.description: The purpose of this bill is to give additional duties for the Secretary of State relating to voter registration.

1158.title: Requiring the Auditor to train members of local instrumentalities of counties and municipalities in appropriate rules of order and the West Virginia Ethics Act
1158.description: The purpose of this bill is to require the Auditor to train members of local instrumentalities of counties and municipalities in appropriate rules of order and the West Virginia Ethics Act. It allows additional training and requires participation by the members.

1159.title: Eliminating the West Virginia Greyhound Breeding Development Fund and transferring that money and future money that would have gone to that fund one-half to the Public Employees Insurance Agency
1159.description: The purpose of this bill is to abolish the Greyhound Breeding Development Fund and to transfer those funds one-half to the Public Employees Insurance Agency and one- half to the IDD waiver program of DHHR..

1160.title: Allowing a mother breastfeeding a child to be excused from jury duty
1160.description: The purpose of this bill is to allow a mother breastfeeding a child to be excused from jury duty.

1161.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1161.title: Relating to permitted use and possession of marihuana
1161.description: The purpose of this bill is to decriminalize and permit personal use, growth and possession of certain amounts of marihuana by persons over the age of twenty-one under certain circumstances; to remove marihuana from the list of schedule I drugs; to create a tax stamp for eligible persons to purchase to allow for possession of up to two ounces or marihuana; to provide method for distribution of stamps; to decriminalize first offense distribution of under 30 grams of marihuana; to establish news criminal penalties for marihuana possession and sale; and to provide for a medical exemption to criminal laws against marihuana use or possession.

1162.last_action: To House Health and Human Resources
1162.title: Authorizing the medical use of cannabis based pharmaceutical products
1162.description: The purpose of this bill is to authorize the medical use of cannabis based pharmaceutical products.

1163.title: Creating a board for review of officer-involved deaths
1163.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish procedures for investigation and review of police officer-involved deaths.

1164.title: Exempting commercial airlines from obtaining licenses to serve liquor, beer or wine on flights
1164.description: The purpose of this bill is to exempt commercial airlines from the licensing requirements of the state.

1165.title: Requiring community corrections performance measurement standards for agencies responsible for supervising individuals placed on probation
1165.description: The purpose of this bill is to require community corrections performance measurement standards for agencies responsible for supervising individuals placed on probation, serving a period of parole or post-incarceration supervision after jail.Â The bill defines terms and requires reports.

1166.title: Relating to the sale of vehicles whose title is branded as total loss, salvage, or similar brand
1166.description: The purpose of this bill is to provide for record keeping of and create a database of the sale or purchase of motor vehicles whose title is branded as total loss, salvage or similar brand.

1167.title: Defining the term minor boundary adjustment
1167.description: The purpose of this bill is to define the term “minor boundary adjustment.”

1170.title: Providing that individuals working in certain seasonal employment are not eligible for unemployment compensation benefits
1170.description: The purpose of this bill is to; provide that individuals working in certain seasonal employment are not eligible for unemployment compensation benefits.Â Seasonal employee is defined as an individual who is employed for a limited time only or that individual’s performance is contemplated for a particular piece of work, usually of short duration.Â This includes individuals who are employed seasonally at athletic or entertainment venues and arenas.

1171.title: Codifying the West Virginia Procedures Manual for the Education of Students with Exceptionalities
1171.description: The purpose of this bill is to establish in the West Virginia Code procedures relating to implementation of the federal Individuals with Disabilities Education Improvement Act of 2004 and to update the procedures and interpretations that have been implemented by the State Board of Education.

1172.title: Creating a program of instruction for students in workforce preparedness to be added to the curriculum of courses in secondary schools

1173.title: Relating to adding a requirement for the likelihood of imminent lawless action to the prerequisites for the crime of intimidation and retaliation
1173.description: The purpose of this bill is to add the provisions of Brandenburg v. Ohio, 395 U.S. 444 (1969) clarifying that threats against public officials are actionable only in such instances where such threats are likely to incite or produce such imminent lawless action.

1174.title: Relating to providing the procedures for the filling of vacancies in the offices of justices of the Supreme Court of Appeals, circuit judge, family court judge or magistrate and making certain clarifications

1175.title: Relating to coal mining generally
1175.description: The purpose of this bill is to enhance the state’s mine safety and environmental statutes. The bill makes findings. The bill eliminates the Department of Environmental Protection Office of Explosives and Blasting and consolidates the remaining duties and responsibilities related to blasting to the Department of Environmental Protection Division of Mining and Reclamation. The bill adds blasting oversight. The bill provides that the Department of Environmental Protection shall revise rules on hydrologic protection and stormwater runoff analyses on mining operations and to promulgate rules that conform with the federal regulations requirements to minimize the disturbances to the prevailing hydrologic balance at a mine site and in associated off-site areas. The bill provides that cumulative hydrologic impact assessment may be conducted.Â The bill requires a statement of probable hydrologic consequences and to prevent flooding. The bill requires the Department of Environmental Protection to follow deadlines for approving or denying applications for site specific water quality criteria. The bill modifies certain findings, ventilation requirements, safety inspection for gases, and roof or rib requirements. The bill permits the director to amend penalties. The bill provides that state mine rescue teams may serve as back up mine rescue teams for mines in this state. The bill provides that the Director of the Office of Miners’ Health, Safety and Training shall have the authority to amend rules for the use of diesel equipment in the state’s mines. The bill provides that in hearings over suspensions for positive drug tests, the state Board of Appeals to allow evidence of testing procedures and test results be introduced through notarized affidavits from Medical Review Officers and testify if necessary. The bill provides for telephonic testimony under oath. The bill provides that the penalty for not reporting accidents in fifteen minutes to the Office of Miners’ Health, Safety and Training be modified to “up to $100,000”. The bill provides that the Director of Office of Miners’ Health, Safety and Training shall have the authority to modify assessed penalties and penalties and that assessed penalties may be modified by the state Board of Appeals based on a vote of two board members. The bill allows company input into state supervisory training and how it is to be scheduled during the year. The bill provides a method in case a miners’ wireless emergency communication device fails.Â

1354.title: Relating to the creation of a Citizens Redistricting Commission to redistrict Senate, House of Delegates and Congressional Districts

1355.title: Reducing the length of terms for members of the West Virginia Board of Education
1355.description: The purpose of this resolution is to reduce the length of terms for members of the West Virginia board of education from nine years to six years.   Strike‑throughs indicate language that would be stricken from the present Constitution, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

1356.title: Exemption from ad valorem taxation of manufacturing inventory and equipment
1356.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the West Virginia Constitution that would exempt personal property in the form of manufacturing inventory and manufacturing equipment from ad valorem taxation.

1357.title: Property tax limitation and homestead exemption amendment of 1982
1357.description: The purpose of this bill is to propose a Constitutional amendment that would lock the value of a homestead property owned by a citizen of sixty‑five years of age or older, for the purpose of calculating property taxes, at the assessed value when the owner‑occupier turned sixty‑five or purchased the property, whichever occurred later. Strike‑throughs indicate language that would be stricken from a heading or the present law, and underscoring indicates new language that would be added.

1358.title: Redistricting of Senate, House of Delegates and Congressional Districts
1358.description: The purpose of this joint resolution is to propose an amendment to the West Virginia Constitution that would require the creation of a Citizens Redistricting Commission to redistrict Senate, House of Delegates, and congressional districts.

1359.title: Supervision of Free Schools
1359.description: The purpose of this resolution is to vest the supervision of free schools in the Legislature, to make the board of education an advisory body, and to modify the composition and terms of the board of education

1361.title: Senior Citizen Homestead Valuation Amendment
1361.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose a Constitutional amendment that increases the amount of the homestead exemption to $30,000 on January 1, 2017 and to $40,000 on January 1, 2020. The resolution also decreases the age eligible to take the exemption to sixty-two.

1362.title: The Simple Majority Levy Approval Amendment
1362.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the state Constitution to allow simple majority approval for county, city and municipal tax levies.

1363.title: Senators and Delegates Term Limit Amendment
1363.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the state Constitution to limit persons serving as Senators from serving more than three consecutive terms and serving as Delegates for more than six consecutive terms.

1364.title: Term Limits for Senators and Delegates in the West Virginia Legislature
1364.description: The purpose of this resolution is to limit the number of terms a senator or delegate may serve in the West Virginia Legislature.

1365.title: State Apportionment Commission
1365.description: The purpose of this resolution is to propose an amendment to the State Constitution that would allow citizens to participate directly in the formation of legislative districts by creating a nonpartisan citizen commission which will hold public hearings around the state and present a redistricting bill to the Legislature.

1366.title: Constitutional Officers Term Limit Amendment
1366.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the state Constitution to limit the terms of any persons serving as Senators, Delegates and Governor.

1367.title: West Virginia Infrastructure Improvement and Industrial Development Amendment of 2016
1367.description: The purpose of this resolution is to offer to the voters the opportunity to allow the Legislature to authorize the issuance and sale of state bonds not exceeding the aggregate amount of one billion dollars to be used for infrastructure improvement and industrial development.

1368.title: Legislative Review of Judiciary Budget Amendment
1368.description: The purpose of this resolution is to authorize the Legislature to review and adjust the budget proposed by the judicial branch of state government.

1369.title: Citizens' Education Accountability Amendment
1369.description: The purpose of this resolution is to provide for the establishment of legislative review, amendment, disapproval, or approval, of the actions of the State Board of Education.

1370.title: Requirement of two thirds of Members of Legislature to override Governor's Veto Amendment
1370.description: The purpose of this resolution is to amend the Constitution in order to raise the threshold number of votes in each house of the Legislature needed to override a veto, from a simple majority to two-thirds of the members.

1372.title: Redistricting Amendment
1372.description: The purpose of this bill is to appoint a five member independent commission to submit plans to the West Virginia Legislature on .how to effectively and democratically redistrict the state into one hundred separate delegate districts.

1373.title: Term Limits for Senators and Delegates in the West Virginia Legislature and county commissioners
1373.description: The purpose of this resolution is to limit the number of terms a senator or delegate may serve in the West Virginia Legislature and the number of terms a county commissioner may serve.
